# groupuniquecounts

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of groupuniquecounts is to provide the function "group_unique_counts", which groups a data frame by a specified column "x" and counts the distinct values in another specified column "y". It also provides checks for the validity of inputs.

## Installation

You can install the development version of groupuniquecounts from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:


```r
install_github("stat545ubc-2024/groupuniquecounts", ref = "0.1.1")
```


## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}
library(groupuniquecounts)
group_unique_counts(mtcars, cyl, gear)
group_unique_counts(mtcars, cyl, carb, na.rm = TRUE)
```
